data.title: How many bricks to buy ?
data.solution:
L, H, Pf, Ph = input().split()
L = int(L)
H = int(H)
Pf = int(Pf)
Ph = int(Ph)
x = ((L*H*Pf) + (H*Ph))*1.1
print(int(x))

data.statement:
A bricklayer wants to build a wall and, to avoid going back and forth between the construction site and the 
brick seller, he must buy {{10%}} more bricks than he needs in case some of them get broken during transport.

The wall will have full bricks and half-bricks, and you will be given the dimensions [[L]] (length) and [[H]] (height) of a brick wall, the price [[Pf]] per brick and the price [[Ph]] per half-brick, and 
you'll need to give the amount of money the bricklayer will have to spend for buying all the necessary bricks.

Each "row" of bricks in the wall will be composed of [[L]] bricks and one half-brick at the end.
There will be [[H]] rows of bricks in the wall.

The wall follows this pattern :
== ==== ==== ====
==== ==== ==== ==
== ==== ==== ====
==== ==== ==== ==
== ==== ==== ====
==== ==== ==== ==
("====" is a brick and "==" is a half-brick in this schema)
Here, [[L]] = 3, [[H]] = 6, [[Pf]] = 3, [[Ph]] = 2 and the output should be 72.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> 4 integers [[L]], [[H]], [[Pf]] and [[Ph]] separated by spaces, where:
[[L]] is the length of the wall,
[[H]] is the height of the wall,
[[Pf]] is the price of a brick,
[[Ph]] is the price of a half-brick.
data.outputDescription: The total price [[T]] (floored integer) on one line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A bricklayer wants to build a wall and, to avoid going back and forth between the construction site and the
brick seller, he must buy 10% more bricks than he needs in case some of them get broken during transport.

The wall will have full bricks and half-bricks, and you will be given the dimensions L (length) and H (height) of a brick wall, the price Pf per brick and the price Ph per half-brick, and
you'll need to give the amount of money the bricklayer will have to spend for buying all the necessary bricks.

Each "row" of bricks in the wall will be composed of L bricks and one half-brick at the end.
There will be H rows of bricks in the wall.

The wall follows this pattern :
== ==== ==== ====
==== ==== ==== ==
== ==== ==== ====
==== ==== ==== ==
== ==== ==== ====
==== ==== ==== ==
("====" is a brick and "==" is a half-brick in this schema)
Here, L = 3, H = 6, Pf = 3, Ph = 2 and the output should be 72.
Input
Line 1: 4 integers L, H, Pf and Ph separated by spaces, where:
L is the length of the wall,
H is the height of the wall,
Pf is the price of a brick,
Ph is the price of a half-brick.
Output
The total price T (floored integer) on one line.
Constraints
{ L, H, Pf, Ph } ≥ 0
Example
Input
2 4 2 1
Output
22
